field.name: summary
field.value: Make it easy to register WCF Services by convention

field.name: description
field.value:
Currently there's not nice way to register services by convention. The best I could come up with is this:
{code lang=csharp} container.Register( Classes.FromAssemblyContaining<UserService>() .Where(Component.IsInSameNamespaceAs<UserService>()) .WithService.DefaultInterfaces() .LifestyleTransient() .Configure(c => c.AsWcfService(new DefaultServiceModel() .Hosted() .OpenEagerly() .AddExtensions(new WcfMetadataExtension().EnableHttpGet()) // NOTE: yes - it is lame, not sure we can do it better ATM .AddEndpoints(WcfEndpoint.ForContract(c.Implementation.GetInterfaces().Single()))))); {code}
Most notably the way to specify endpoints sucks badly as we don't have access to the information about which service contracts are available on the component.
All-in-all this feels way too verbose to me and there's way too many brackets involved.

comment.author: xtoff
comment.text: Perhaps the simplest thing would be to just implicitly add endpoints for each service interface exposed by such component?
